metadata.title: Interindustry Factor Mobility and Technological Change: Evidence on Wage and Profit Dispersion Across U.S. Industries, 1820-1990

relevance.topic: Interindustry factor mobility and technological change
relevance.relevance: The study examines the impact of technological change on interindustry factor mobility, which is directly related to labor displacement due to technological advancements.

dependent_variables.wage_changes: Interindustry wage differentials and profit dispersion

historical_context.institutional_context: Changes in regulations affecting interindustry factor movement

outcomes.main_findings: Interindustry factor mobility increased during the 19th century due to transportation improvements and factory production, but decreased in the 20th century with reliance on specialized equipment and knowledge.
outcomes.conclusions: Technological changes have significantly influenced interindustry factor mobility, with early industrialization increasing mobility and later stages decreasing it.
